old.response_text:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Date: Not in required web-page date format
   What’s wrong: The instruction required a full date in the order year, month day (e.g., 2017, March 15). The citation only gives a year.
   Should be: If the web page shows a full date, include it as: _King James Bible_. (2017, Month Day). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/
   (If the site only provides a year, year-only is acceptable: _King James Bible_. (2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/)

❌ Punctuation after date: missing period
   What’s wrong: There should be a period after the closing parenthesis of the date.
   Should be: _King James Bible_. (2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

❌ Placement/usage of "Original work published" note
   What’s wrong: The phrase "(Original work published: 1769)" is awkwardly appended to the end of the reference. For republished/classic works, an original-publication note belongs directly after the title in parentheses (and is not required for simple website reproductions).
   Should be: Either omit the original-work note for the web reproduction, or place it after the title per book reprint conventions, for example:
   _King James Bible_. (2017) (Original work published 1769). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

(Author name, year, book title in italics, editor parenthetical, and publisher are correctly formatted for APA 7.)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #3
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Date and punctuation: year not in parentheses and punctuation order incorrect
   What’s wrong: The year should appear in parentheses immediately after the editor parenthetical; the citation currently has " (Eds.). 2019." instead of " (Eds.). (2019)."
   Should be: _Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer._

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #4
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: organization name is incorrect/abbreviated improperly
   What’s wrong: "I. O. for Standardization" is not the correct full name of the organization. Use the organization's full official name as the author.
   Should be: **International Organization for Standardization** as the author, e.g.:
   _International Organization for Standardization_. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). ISO. https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

❌ Website name: missing
   What’s wrong: For a webpage reference include the site name (the publisher or website) before the URL if it differs from the author. The entry lacks a site name; "ISO" (or "International Organization for Standardization") should be shown as the site/publisher.
   Should be: _International Organization for Standardization_. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). ISO. https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #5
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Publisher name: contains unnecessary business word
   What’s wrong: APA 7 asks to use the publisher name in its short form and to omit words like "Company," "Co.," "Publishers," or "Inc." where customary. "HarperCollins Publishers" is unnecessarily wordy.
   Should be: _O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins._

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

new_v1.response_text:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: webpage (online edition of a classical work)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Missing/incorrect placement
   What’s wrong: The entry begins with the title; the author (or organization author) is not provided. For a web page, the organization that is the author (if applicable) should appear first. If the organization is both author and site name, list it as the author and omit a duplicate site name.
   Should be: **Author (organization) first**, e.g., _International example:_ **King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/_  
   (If the organization is author and site name are identical, do not repeat the site name.)

❌ Date: Format may be incomplete
   What’s wrong: Webpage dates should be in the order Year, Month Day when that full date is available. The citation shows only the year; if a full date is available on the page it should be used.
   Should be: **King James Bible Online. (2017, Month Day). _King James Bible_. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/**  
   (If only the year is available on the page, (2017) is acceptable.)

❌ Order/structure: Elements in wrong order for a web page reference
   What’s wrong: The title appears before the author, and the website name placement is incorrect given APA web page format.
   Should be: **King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/** (Original work published 1769).  
   Note: If you include the original publication date for a classical work, place that note at the end of the reference: **(Original work published 1769)**

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Notes: 
- Book title in the entry is in sentence case (first word capitalized), editor is given correctly as (P. J. C. Field, Ed.), and publisher is provided. If you prefer a slightly different rendering of the publisher name (e.g., "D.S. Brewer" without spaces), that is a stylistic publisher-name variant but not an APA error.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #3
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: edited book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Year placement/parentheses:
   What’s wrong: The publication year must appear in parentheses immediately after the authors/editors. Here the editors parenthetical and the year are separated and the year is not in parentheses.
   Should be: **Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A new companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.**

❌ Title capitalization:
   What’s wrong: Book titles should use sentence case (only the first word of the title, the first word after a colon, and proper nouns are capitalized). The original shows title-style capitalization.
   Should be: **_A new companion to Malory_** (not _A New Companion to Malory_)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #4
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: standard / webpage (organization as author)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author name: Incorrect/abbreviated organization name
   What’s wrong: The organization author is written as an abbreviation/odd phrasing ("I. O. for Standardization."). APA requires the full name of the organization as author.
   Should be: **International Organization for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html**

Note:
- If the organization author and website name are identical, you do not repeat the site name after the title; providing the URL is sufficient.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #5
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: book (children’s book with illustrator)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Publisher name:
   What’s wrong: APA prefers the current, common form of the publisher name without organizational suffixes like "Publishers" when the publisher's brand is sufficient. The well-known publisher name is "HarperCollins."
   Should be: **O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins.**

✓ Title and illustrator credit: correctly formatted (title in sentence case and illustrator credited as (Initial Last, Illus.))

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

If you want, I can produce corrected, fully formatted APA 7 reference entries for all five citations using the fixes above.

new_v2.response_text:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Missing or misplaced
   Problem: The citation does not place the author (organization) in the author position. The website (King James Bible Online) should appear as the author if no individual author is given.
   Should be: King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_. King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

❌ Date: Format ambiguous
   Problem: Instruction required full date in order year, month day when available. The citation gives only the year; if the web page has a full publication date, it should be included.
   Should be (if full date is available): King James Bible Online. (2017, Month Day). _King James Bible_. King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)
   Note: If only the year is available on the page, (2017) is acceptable.

❌ Placement of original-publication note
   Problem: "(Original work published: 1769)" is placed after the URL and uses a colon. In APA the original-publication note, if included, belongs immediately after the title and is formatted without a colon.
   Should be: King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_ (Original work published 1769). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Notes: Title is in sentence-style capitalization (first word capitalized, proper noun Arthur capitalized). Editor parenthetical and publisher are formatted correctly.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

CITATION #3
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: edited book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Year / punctuation: Year must be in parentheses
   Problem: The year appears as plain "2019." after the editor parenthetical rather than as "(2019)."
   Should be: Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A new companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

❌ Title capitalization: Use sentence case for book titles
   Problem: Title is in title case ("A New Companion to Malory"). APA reference-list book titles require sentence case (capitalize only first word and proper nouns).
   Should be: _A new companion to Malory_

Combined corrected citation (using required elements):
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A new companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

CITATION #4
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: standard / webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Organization name incorrect / improperly abbreviated
   Problem: "I. O. for Standardization." is not the proper name of the organization and is an incorrect abbreviation/order. The full organization name should be used as the author.
   Should be: International Organization for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

❌ Publisher / site name note (informational)
   Problem: If the author is the same as the website/publisher (International Organization for Standardization), you generally omit a separate site/publisher name. The citation above is fine once the author is corrected.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

CITATION #5
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: book (illustrated children's book)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Publisher name: use the form of the publisher's name as styled in APA (omit redundant business words)
   Problem: "HarperCollins Publishers" includes the word "Publishers"; APA examples typically use the commonly used publisher name "HarperCollins."
   Should be: O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins.

✓ Title, authors, year, and illustrator parenthetical otherwise formatted correctly.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

If you want, I can produce corrected, fully formatted reference-list entries for all five citations in one block.
